title: Tagliatelle: social tagging to encourage healthier eating
abstract:
This paper describes the design and initial evaluation of\ud
Tag-liatelle, a collaborative tagging application for\ud
encouraging healthier eating. Users photograph their\ud
own meals and upload these photos to a website,\ud
where fellow users anonymously tag them for content.\ud
Initial results suggest that tagging of food content is a\ud
popular activity. However, further work must be done\ud
to automate the extraction of valid nutritional\ud
information from the tags generated
